result.execSummary:
The defendant Linc S. Leu was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was found eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program but not until after serving 3 years of prison time. Defendant granted credit for 516 days served.
Concurrent with: Sentence in this case to run concurrent with sentence in 13CF117.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all felony convictions.
On all financial obligations, 25% of any inmate funds to be applied during incarceration and once on extended supervision, remaining  fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent. AMENDED 6/29/17:  COURT ORDERED DNA SURCHARGE TO BE REMOVED.
Defendant is to comply with all aftercare recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises unless as a condition of employment and then only with the prior approval of the agent.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. All perscriptions are to be filled at only one pharmacy. Defendant is to sign whatever releases are necessary for the agent to monitor defendant's use of medication.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
Concurrent with: Sentence in this case to run concurrent with 13CF117

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Linc S. Leu

State rests, request bind over  Arraignment scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 01:50 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Weber appearing in person in court  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 2, 2014 at 10:10 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol at all   Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.    Defendant is to submit to a breathalyzer at anytime requested by a law enforcement officer.
01/16/2015 AMENDED from $15,000.00 to $7500.00  Defendant must reside with his parents.  Defendant needs to report daily, every morning,  alcohol and drug free to either Clark County Sheriff's Department or the Abbotsford Police Department for PBTs (preliminary breath tests)

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 10:10 am.
